solution_line_template: Sidney has {adult_cats} adult cats * {cans_per_adult_cat} can of food = <<{adult_cats}*{cans_per_adult_cat}={adult_cat_food_per_day}>>{adult_cat_food_per_day} cans of food per day.
Sidney's adult cats will need {adult_cat_food_per_day} cans * {num_days} days = <<{adult_cat_food_per_day}*{num_days}={adult_cat_food_per_week}>>{adult_cat_food_per_week} cans for the week.
Sidney has {num_kittens} kittens * {cans_per_kitten_fraction} cup of food = <<{num_kittens}*{cans_per_kitten_fraction}={kitten_food_per_day}>>{kitten_food_per_day} cans of food per day.
Sidney's kittens will need {kitten_food_per_day} cans * {num_days} days = <<{kitten_food_per_day}*{num_days}={kitten_food_per_week}>>{kitten_food_per_week} cans for the week.

Sidney will need to buy {adult_cat_food_per_week} cans + {kitten_food_per_week} cans - {initial_cans} cans = <<{adult_cat_food_per_week}+{kitten_food_per_week}-{initial_cans}={additional_cans_needed}>>{additional_cans_needed} cans.
